data.title: Hospitals in France for Expatriates
data.meta_description: List of hospitals in France for expatriates. Included are hospitals in Paris and hospitals in Nice. International heath insurance acceptance.
data.text:
The Best Hospitals in France

The French healthcare system was named the best on the planet by the World Health Organization in both 2000 and 1997. Expats and French citizens alike reap the benefits of an all-inclusive network of hospitals in France and other medical facilities. In 2013, more than 200,000 medical doctors were practicing in France.

France is the world leader in medical research and state hospitals in France are modernized facilities with progressive treatment strategies. All state hospitals are grouped inside the public assistance (Assistance Publique) for a particular geographic area. They can be categorized in hospital groups (groupe hospitalier), general hospitals (center hospitalier), and university hospitals (centre hospitalier universitaire).

Check with your insurance provider at home before your trip to be clear on your coverage abroad. If you need to, purchase international health insurance as primary or secondary coverage.

Related: Moving to France as an Expat and Health Insurance for Foreigners in France

Best International Hospitals in France

In an annual survey of 400 hospitals in France by the publisher of Le Point, the University Hospital of Toulouse was voted to have the best record for the quality of patient care. It just edged its close rival University Hospital of Toulouse, which took home the crown as the best hospital in France last year.
